intro: Dicerandra immaculata, commonly known as the Florida false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant features slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with a strong, spicy scent. Its small white flowers bloom in late spring, and it thrives in moist, sandy soils. Dicerandra immaculata is often found in wetlands and along the edges of ponds, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
